meta.title: Operation of Coating Pan Spray System

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Coating Pan Spray System for application of film coating, sugar coating, or enteric coating on tablets using automated spray technology.
sections.scope: Applicable to tablet coating activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the coating pan is installed in a clean area with proper ventilation.
Verify that all utilities including electricity, compressed air, and water are connected.
Check that coating solution, tablets, and drying air supply are ready.
Power ON the coating pan and spray system control panel.
Set the pan rotation speed according to tablet size and batch quantity.
Set inlet air temperature, air flow rate, and exhaust parameters.
Load tablets into the coating pan (fill 50-70% of pan volume for optimal coating).
Start pan rotation at low speed and allow tablets to cascade smoothly.
Turn ON the inlet air supply and adjust temperature to drying conditions.
Prepare coating solution ensuring proper mixing and uniform consistency.
Fill the spray gun reservoir or connect peristaltic pump to coating solution container.
Position spray guns at appropriate angle and distance from tablet bed.
Start spraying coating solution at low rate initially.
Adjust spray rate, atomization pressure, and pattern for uniform coating.
Monitor tablet bed temperature continuously (maintain within specified range).
Observe coating uniformity and adjust parameters if orange peel or tackiness occurs.
Continue coating process until desired coating thickness or weight gain is achieved.
After spraying completion, continue pan rotation with hot air for drying.
Gradually reduce drying temperature and air flow during final drying phase.
Stop the pan rotation and unload coated tablets carefully.
Inspect tablets for coating uniformity, smoothness, and absence of defects.
Clean the coating pan, spray guns, and nozzles immediately after use.
Document all coating parameters, weight gain, and quality observations in the batch record.
precautions: Maintain proper tablet bed temperature to prevent over-drying or sticking.
Ensure coating solution is properly mixed and free from lumps.
Adjust spray rate according to drying capacity to prevent tablet sticking.
Clean spray nozzles regularly to prevent clogging.
Monitor weight gain periodically to achieve target coating thickness.
Avoid over-wetting which can cause tablet agglomeration.
Ensure proper pan loading (not too full or too empty) for uniform coating.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, mask, and protective clothing.
Handle coating solvents in well-ventilated areas.
Follow cleaning validation protocols for product changeover.
